bar
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  bar.Utils
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlugIn
public class Utils
extends Object
implements PlugIn

A collection of utilities to interact with BAR and scripting aids for ImageJ. For more information about BAR see its documentation pages on imagej.net and GitHub.

listDirectory

public static void listDirectory(String dir,
                                 int xPos,
                                 int yPos)
Prints the contents of a directory to a dedicated TextWindow displayed at the specified location. The location reverts to the center of the screen if one of the specified coordinates is invalid).

An error message is displayed in a dialog box if directory could not be found or if directory is empty (see fileExists(File)).

A FileDrop listener is attached to the TextWindow, which means that, once displayed, the method can be triggered by dragging and dropping files from the native file manager.

Some system files (hidden files, Thumbs.db) are excluded from the list. If the directory is empty, users are prompted with the option to reveal the file in the native file browser (see revealFile(String)).

Users can double click on a listed file path to have it open by ImageJ.

Parameters:
dir - Path of the directory to be listed
xPos - The screen x location (from top-left corner) where the TextWindow should be displayed
yPos - The screen y location (from top-left corner) where the TextWindow should be displayed
See Also:
listDirectory(String), listDirectory(String, boolean)

listDirectory

public static void listDirectory(String dir)
Prints the contents of a directory to a dedicated TextWindow displayed on the center of the screen.

Parameters:
dir - the path of the directory to be listed
See Also:
listDirectory(String, int, int), listDirectory(String, boolean)

listDirectory

public static void listDirectory(String dir,
                                 boolean cascade)
Prints the contents of a directory to a dedicated TextWindow allowed to be displayed with a slight offset from frontmost window. This "cascade" positioning defaults to the center of the screen if frontmost window could not be retrieved or is too close to screen boundaries.

Parameters:
dir - the path of the directory to be listed
cascade - if true TextWindow "cascades" from ImageJ's frontmost window. If false, TextWidow is displayed in the center of the screen
See Also:
listDirectory(String, int, int), listDirectory(String)

openScript

public static void openScript(String dir,
                              String filename)
Opens the specified file in the IJ2 Script Editor or in the IJ1 built-in Editor, if the former cannot be found (vanilla IJ1). No tests assessing the existence of specified file/directory are performed.

Parameters:
dir - the directory containing the file to be opened
filename - the filename of the file to be opened
See Also:
openIJ2Script(File), openIJ1Script(String, String)

openIJ1Script

Parameters:
dir - the directory containing the file to be opened
filename - the filename of the file to be opened
See Also:
openScript(String, String), openIJ2Script(File)

openSnippet

public static void openSnippet(String filename)
Opens the specified file in the "Snippets" directory of BAR. No tests assessing the existence of the specified file are performed.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the script to be opened
See Also:
getSnippetsDir(), openScript(String, String)

openLib

public static void openLib(String filename)
Opens the specified file in the "lib" directory of BAR. No tests assessing the existence of the specified file are performed.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the lib/ file to be opened
See Also:
openScript(String, String), getLibDir()

fileExists

public static boolean fileExists(File file)
Tests whether a file or directory exists. An error message is displayed in a dialog box if file cannot be found

Parameters:
file - the File to be tested
Returns:
true, if successful.
See Also:

fileExists

public static boolean fileExists(String filepath)
Tests whether a file or directory exists at the specified path. An error message is displayed in a dialog box if file path is invalid

Parameters:
filepath - the file path to be tested
Returns:
true, if successful
See Also:

revealFile

public static void revealFile(String filePath)
"Reveals" the file associated with the specified file path in the operating system. Described in revealFile(File)

Parameters:
filePath - the file path to be opened by the operating system
See Also:
fileExists(File)

revealFile

public static void revealFile(File file)
"Reveals" the specified file path in the operating system. If file is a directory, opens it in the file manager of the operating system, otherwise the application associated with the file type will be launched. An error message is displayed in a dialog box if file path is invalid, or if the operating system could not be detected.

Parameters:
file - the file to be opened by the operating system
See Also:
fileExists(File)
